website_summaries.verdict: An extremely lightweight and highly portable option with a range of features that make it stand out from the competition.
pros: We love how easy it is to inflate, with no need for a pump
Its Triangular Core Matrix and ThermaCapture helps to reduce heat loss
Available in three sizes and comes with a handy carry bag
cons: Not warm enough for cold-weather use

customer_reviews.title: Nice light pad
customer_reviews.text: Pretty comfortable. Takes a bit of effort to blow up, but no big deal. Tends to be slippery so when I want to turn onto my side I grip the edges so I don't go flying off. Last time I used it the temp was about 32 F outside and I didn't feel any cold from the ground. Great for a 70+ yr old who can't carry a lot of weight on back-country trips.
customer_reviews.author: Ray D.

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable and light
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable and light. Packed size can't be beat. But this thing is the loudest sleeping pad ever. It's like sleeping on a bag of potato chips. My wife won't ever let me use this because she would never be able to get to sleep with the noise this makes. So if you are camping solo and the noise doesn't bother you then this is great. Otherwise you should probably consider something else
customer_reviews.author: Eric Williams

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The baffling on the inside of the thermarest wasn't consistent. It looks like a big bump in the middle of the pad, and it is impossible to sleep on comfortably. It happened week 1 of a 6 week camping trip. When we got home from the trip it was to late to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Walter J. Palen

customer_reviews.title: Great, confortable (unless your back is big), durable, worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: Thru-hiked almost the entire of the Appalachian Trail with this (2189.3 miles), not a single hole in it still in one piece. If would have to order again i would get the large size, one of my arms was hanging (my back is a bit above average in width) and after sleeping almost everyday it becomes uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge M

customer_reviews.title: Would only recommend for ultralight packing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pad to save weight on a 10 day horse packing trip. It was a waste of money. Too narrow. Too noisy. Too short. If I ever do this type of trip again, I'll look for something wider and longer
customer_reviews.author: J. Nagel

customer_reviews.title: Practical, just loud!
customer_reviews.text: Just completed a 10 night camping trip with the Therm-a-rest NeoAir XLite Pros: Lightweight, compact, and you'll never sleep on the actual ground Cons: LOUD, crinkles with every move. If your tent-mate doesn't have the same pad you'll probably hear some complaints. It's also a but narrow, I would have loved another 2 inches on the sides.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Power

customer_reviews.title: I got a winglock valve and it was as good as sleeping on my own bed.
customer_reviews.text: I just went on a backpacking trip through Lake Tahoe and I had camped in many rocky areas with this pad. On a hard rocky surface, this sleeping pad made me feel like I was sleeping on my own bed. It was shockingly good. Pros: 1)Extremely comfortable. 2)Very easy to inflate. It took me around 10 puffs. 3)Very soft to the touch. This is one benefit which lot of people seem to overlook. 4)Winglock valve is very easy to use and holds the pad's air well. Cons: 1)must inflate daily or the pad can be less than effective. 3)somewhat bulky (not too bulky).
customer_reviews.author: Jaewoo Kim

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for my 61 year old bones, warm, super lightweight and compact, easy to inflate
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a pad that would keep my hip bones happy (I'm a side sleeper), be ultra lightweight and compact, easy to inflate, and with an R value providing some warmth. This fit the bill on all counts. I might have wanted to check out the "women's" version which is a little wider and less long, and has a higher R value. (Honestly, why they assign gender to these is beyond me: are men slim, lanky, and don't need as much warmth?) Some have noted a crinkly "Doritos bag" sound when you move around, but I haven't noticed that when I sleep. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: rolfdenver

customer_reviews.title: Great luxury for back country backpacking!
customer_reviews.text: No more sleepless nights on the trail for me! This is perfect for back and side sleeping. Yes, it does take a bit of lung power to get it inflated - which at altitude can be a bit of a workout - but the good night's sleep is worth it. Very light. No real noise that is any different from sleeping bag rubbing against any other synthetic underpad.
customer_reviews.author: Andiek11

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself before Christmas. Come Christmas it was marked down about $25, which I found upsetting. Great for whomever found the deal, but bad for me b/c so expensive. Otherwise, a good purchase. The ground in a tent is often cold, but I didn't have any problems with that while laying on this mattress. I wish I would have bought the long mattress [I'm 5'9"] just for added comfort. I bought the adult small and it hits about knee level. I was trying to save weight, but managed to throw comfort aside. Otherwise, GREAT air mattress. SUPER compact. Weighs as expected. SUPER lightweight and WARM. Would buy again. Good job, ThermasRest.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Simms

customer_reviews.title: The only mat I would through hike with.
customer_reviews.text: This was a game changer for me on the PCT while through hiking. I thought I could get away with a different designs but my hips would hurt too much with other inflatable pads. I have a history of low back issues and I needed something that I could really rest on after hiking/backpacking 8-12 hours per day. This pad stays inflated, is insulating, and comfortable. I could even slip my pack under the foot section to create some elevation while I slept at night.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten

customer_reviews.title: Durably holds air
customer_reviews.text: After buying several others that leaked air immediately right out of the package I finally found the one true product. Love the valve system. More money yes. But if I didn’t waste my money on the others I could have had reliability and comfort right away. Don’t be fooled by cheap crap. This is the one. I survive on this EVERY night. If it can hold up to my conditions it will rock YOUR world.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey English

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: My wife love this sleeping mat her new favorite sleeping gear for hiking AT. Slept well no pressure points, never rolled off it, and it feels like it generates a warmth to body surface rather than feeling cold. Even though have to blow it up about 30 buffs it deflates well and easy to roll up and packs in compact bag - great for lightweight backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Marcantonio

customer_reviews.title: Still worth the money, if you camp a lot, it's still the best to get.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one i bought for wife. At first we got a cheaper brand Sleepingo that boasts just as good, but nope, that brand was not nearly thick enough after inflated. She weights 135 lbs, and was feeling the ground with the slightest turn, body shifting movement while testing out Sleepingo. I pulled mine out to compare and it was a no brainer to buy another one. I've had mine since 2013, zero complaint, worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Julienne H. Hsu

customer_reviews.title: Great product as usual from thermarest
customer_reviews.text: Great product as usual from thermarest, Not as small packed down as the sea to summit ultralight, but your getting a 3.5 r value vs. a 0,7.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin K Steiner

customer_reviews.title: So light! So warm!
customer_reviews.text: So light and so compact! Surprisingly high R value for the weight too. Takes 15 breaths to inflate and you should help yourself out by filling half way, closing the valve and scrunching up the top to push the air to the foot before adding the rest of the air. (The instructions say this but I figure no one is reading those) I'd give it 5 stars but it is a little narrow so my arms fall off the side.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for hiking and camping trips
customer_reviews.text: This packs super small and light. It is great if you are tight on space or if you are hiking for multiple days. The only thing I dislike is that it can be noisy if you shuffle or move in your sleep as others might hear it and get woken. But very comfortable to sleep on!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Aichele

customer_reviews.title: Light weight but not lightweight comfort
customer_reviews.text: I recently completed the 5-day, 50-mile pack back trip called the Rocky Mountain Marathon with the group called Voice of Wilderness and having this was a godsend. I'm just over 6' tall and it worked great for me. It even fit inside my sleeping bag with me in the bag - no more sliding off the mattress. I appreciated the easy of inflation and deflation as well as the comfort it provided. It took up almost no room in my pack and was very light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Walt J.

customer_reviews.title: Light and comfy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace my klymit inertia pad. This one is lighter, insulated and more comfortable. More money though. Just wish they made a regular in a wide version. The 20 inch width is too narrow, my arms fall off the pad while on my back. Not a huge dealbreaker. It is a difficult mattress to blow up after a day bikepacking at elevation in the mountains.
customer_reviews.author: Patti B

customer_reviews.title: Love my Thermarest
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this all season and I have never been disappointed. I am using it in my hammock on chilly nights and it offers great warmth and in the tent it works perfectly for my pad. I am so happy with this product. Rolling it up you have to do it just right to get the air out of it to fold it up compact to fit in the bag - it took a few tries to get it right.
customer_reviews.author: Outside Feet

customer_reviews.title: #1 Product for Backpacking
customer_reviews.text: I will forever be in debt to my Therm-a-rest NeoAir XLite! It is why I am able to go backpacking as a former glamper who preferred an air mattress for camping or not going at all. This sleeping pad turned me into a backpacker as it is extremely lightweight, keeps you warm (keeps in the heat) and does not deflate overnight light my air mattress does! The quality of sleep I get on this pad is outstanding. So happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Crandle

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use as a floor in an inflatable boat, not as a sleeping mat. Works great for that. It's a bit crinkly sounding, so it might take getting used to if trying to sleep. But it takes sitting on and standing on without popping which is what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: You Shot Me Down

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed! Bought for a cross country ride starting end of June. Had thermarest in the past and thought this would work. Wish I had actually tried sleeping on it! I roll off it and it has a crinkling sound every time I move. Do not know how to return it!
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Narrow & uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a backpacking trip this fall & finally found the time to test it out well after the return window closed. My 2 night stay revealed 2 glaring problems. 1- When fully inflated it felt like I had a bulge raising my lower back. I let some air out till my butt was almost touching the ground & it only got a bit better. Did not feel comfortable. 2- It is too narrow. When laying on my back my arms could not lay on the pad. Its only as wide as my chest. My arms had to lay on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff G.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! I love the weight and the durability of ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! I love the weight and the durability of it, while it lasted a couple months of traveling I ended up getting a Sea-to-Summit pad because this pad was not very good for stomach sleepers for myself. I have used this pad in as low as 20 degrees and it kept me warm, not toasty warm but warm none the less. I have both the original size and the women's version, both been good to me and my girlfriend for years now.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good pad, just a couple of nit picks...
customer_reviews.text: My first air pad for camping/hiking and I am not disappointed. A little slippery but I may need to play around with the "fill" of it. My only criticism is that it is awfully (even for me!) slender. Which only presents as an issue when I'm being "restless" as I'm trying to go to sleep. Would recommend/would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Anelmo

customer_reviews.title: very light and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: well made US product. very comfortable and light. like other reviews said it is noisy when you move but nothing that would keep you awake at night. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for small people and side sleepers
customer_reviews.text: This the best inflatable pad for anyone looking to save weight and SLEEPS ON THEIR SIDE or is a smaller person. For reference I am 6'1" and 205lbs. When I lay on my back or stomach it is simply too narrow which is why this isn't my favourite pad. But if you're smaller or sleep on your side it's amazing. Not too loud, very thick and warm. Only 6oz.
customer_reviews.author: Piotr Szarecki

customer_reviews.title: Great pad for keeping pack weight down.
customer_reviews.text: Supper light and packs down small. It’s comfortable and warm but I found myself getting over heated at times. Early season I’ll probably use a lighter bag because of it. Only negative is it’s a little noisy but I wouldn’t let that stop anyone from getting
customer_reviews.author: Tree

customer_reviews.title: Good for the long winded
customer_reviews.text: This pad is very light and packs up compactly. It is comfortable and works well with my new quilt to keep me warm and comfortable after a long hike. The only downside is blowing it up- takes a lot of air! Overall a good pad that gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: A. Havener

customer_reviews.title: Very Noisy
customer_reviews.text: Great pad, very lightweight, durable and easy to pack up every morning. One complaint, VERY noisy with any movement, anyone camped nearby will complain.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Smith

customer_reviews.title: But that seems like a small trade off for a 12oz inflatable with ...
customer_reviews.text: My ONLY complaint would be that it is a little noisy (crinkles when you turn over). But that seems like a small trade off for a 12oz inflatable with such a high R value. Used it in a 40degree temps and was very pleased. Going next month (December) and will update if needed when tested in colder temps.
customer_reviews.author: David Iseminger II

customer_reviews.title: love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: love, love this mattress. Makes alot of noise from what gfriend said.....but I slept like a baby through the monster noises and creepers she was hearing through out the night.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: It blows
customer_reviews.text: What good is it if it's not comfortable. That mattress blows. Ah hahaha
customer_reviews.author: Scarecrow

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Pad didn't make it through the first night. Would not hold air past two hours. I Was stuck out 7 nights on the CDT. Was not able to return because I was given a two week window.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Great pad but it's krinkly!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed a pad with a better R factor, and this pad definitely keeps you warm and toasty at night! However the krinkling if you toss and turn is really noisy. I wish I bought the wider pad, too. Even though it's 4oz heavier, the extra 5 inches would be amazing to have (I'm a side sleeper) and would probably keep me from tossing and turning so much. On the 20" pad, my arms fall off when I sleep on my back.
customer_reviews.author: Adventures12

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Super compact and light weight when deflated. Very supportive and comfortable. A little narrow but you can deflate it a tad and it will contour to your shoulders and hips. Awesome for backpacking and comes with a repair kit
customer_reviews.author: Riley

customer_reviews.title: Started leaking after only a few uses
customer_reviews.text: Pad was comfortable and quite warm, but has a slow leak which causes it to deflate substantially overnight. Seems to be a valve issue - dissapointed as it was quite expensive and is only a few months old.
customer_reviews.author: Clara Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Packs small and light but very comfortable when inflated
customer_reviews.text: Despite being a full-length pad, this therm-a-rest actually packs smaller and lighter than my old 3/4 length therm-a-rest! It's more comfortable too. I'd probably get a 3/4 length pad if I had to do it again just because I could easily use a pack or something else under my feet when sleeping, but that's a personal choice.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Springer

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow first night but got used too it
customer_reviews.text: The second night I got used too the narrowness and has been amazingly comfortable being my first ever backpacking air mattress. Still bring the 48" ridge rest to keep it from getting a leak and insulation. One of the ribs is busging up but not leaking so probably fine.
customer_reviews.author: slacker

customer_reviews.title: Best sleep I have had in the woods
customer_reviews.text: Best sleep I have had in the woods, you can make a trashbag pump (look up videos on youtube) to make the inflation easier. It may be a bit noisy for some, but I don't mind.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculously light and small, yet incredibly comfortable. Best backpacking pad I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: docfeelgood

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I'm switching to this after my REI Flash started to leak. This pad is lighter, more comfortable, feels more durable, and you can switch out the valve if the valve starts to leak. The only con is that it crinkles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best sleeping pad on the market.
customer_reviews.text: There is a reason you see this at the top of the list year after year. It does make a little noise but I definitely don't get the load bubble wrap popping sound some people claim.
customer_reviews.author: brianmichaels

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight and packs down very small, does make noise but you shouldn't worry about it too much.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely lightweight and small packsize, yet inflates up quite well and is very comfortable to sleep on - however it is of course narrow so you can't really turn much, but still quite comfortable in terms of softness etc. The crinkle noise that everyone complains about does exist, but once you're settled in, you will only be making small adjustments in your sleep. The initial 'getting comfortable' phase is noisy but after that you shouldn't be concerned with waking others.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Barrett

customer_reviews.title: A piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: Never held air. Contacted Backcountry a couple of weeks after my 30 days and they refuse to do anything about it. Crappy products, the supplier sold me a piece of worthless crap.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas H.

customer_reviews.title: These mattresses are terrific. One thing to be aware of
customer_reviews.text: These mattresses are terrific. One thing to be aware of....they ship with the stuff sack and repair kit buried inside of the rolled up mattress. I got my first one and thought it was opened and used by someone else and then returned it. The second one I got looked the same and when I unrolled it the sack and repair kit were inside at the bottom of the roll.
customer_reviews.author: Climb-on

customer_reviews.title: regular size a bit to narrow for an average man
customer_reviews.text: Very light and compact. However it is too small and too expensive for what you get out of it. way to much noise pollution. Thermarest needs to drop its price a good 20 percent and work on the noise of their higher r value bags. Im looking into klymit
customer_reviews.author: adam f.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, I couldn't believe the comfort. I will never suffer another sleepless night tossing and turning.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Dubois

customer_reviews.title: Packs smaller but is twice as thick inflated as my old Thermarest
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to relieve my shoulders some. I rotate sleep position from back to one side then the other side. This may help me to stay on my back by letting a bit of air out of the thicker pad to let me sink in some. It's not a whole lot smaller but it's something, and a few ounces lighter too.
customer_reviews.author: Glynn Sluder

customer_reviews.title: ... am 6 feet tall and this fits me just fine. Very comfortable to sleep on
customer_reviews.text: I am 6 feet tall and this fits me just fine. Very comfortable to sleep on. I slept on it for 8 straight nights on a hike up Kilimanjaro and it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Feels good
customer_reviews.text: I can tell that the item l received was already opened, tags were not attached, pump sack liking, air pad dirty, I was very disappointed, l was specting slot from it, I think my review is more about the seller not so much about the item, the pad looks and feels good except for the dirty spots
customer_reviews.author: Jose Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Expensive and Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Super light weight, really nice quality. Not very big but certainly works for sleeping. Provides a little insulation from ground temperature but you still need a temp appropriate sleeping bag. Super expensive but excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Kvasnosky

customer_reviews.title: Check out the "Used" section and save some $!
customer_reviews.text: Glad I went with the "used" section. Saved money and the product was perfectly fine. This pad is noisy (like a chip bag) but the size and warmth rating is worth the noise. I call it my Cheeto bag. It's light and packs tiny in my pack.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon M.

customer_reviews.title: Great pad!
customer_reviews.text: Works very well at keep the coldness of the ground away. I don't hit bottom. Easy to inflat.
customer_reviews.author: nicole barrett

customer_reviews.title: This mattress rocks
customer_reviews.text: This mattress is extremely lightweight and a cinch to inflate. I'm a side sleeper and this is so much more comfortable than the older generation of mattresses. Note: I have not used this in cold weather yet, so no info on insulation.
customer_reviews.author: John Sokolik

customer_reviews.title: Defective. Did not hold air from the first inflation
customer_reviews.text: Defective. Bought this product in January. Tried it for the first time last month, did not retain air from the very first time I blew it up. I slept on the hard ground and was very disappointed. I will be trying to go through thermarest customer service for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Nauman

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Light but noisy. Slippery, could use some non-slip to keep from sliding off it all night long.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Stasa

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight & warm
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace a heavier sleeping pad. Easy to inflate, deflate, & pack. Only 12 oz. so I’m happy with it. Worked great in the field.
customer_reviews.author: S-Mulsow

customer_reviews.title: dont waste money on cheaper alternatives
customer_reviews.text: outstanding. wish i hadn't wasted money trying cheaper alternatives. finally sleeping well on the trail. yay
customer_reviews.author: NorCal Jim

customer_reviews.title: Good but width was too short.
customer_reviews.text: I’m 4’11 and length wide was perfect but only 20” width sucks. I returned it was I felt falling off if it all night. I prefer a 23” or so.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Colon

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and warm!
customer_reviews.text: I used this mat for an overnight in an uninsukated hunting shack that has a wood burning stove when it was -30 out. Slept comfortably until the fire died down and I could almost see my breath, but my back and bottom stayed warm! The R-value of 3.8 does make a difference
customer_reviews.author: Elli

customer_reviews.title: Really great pad!
customer_reviews.text: However it is insanely noisy with how much crinkling sound it makes.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: So much room left in my pack and so light!
customer_reviews.text: So much room left in my pack and so light!
customer_reviews.author: Verified purchase

customer_reviews.title: Provides a comfortable supportive night's rest excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the NeoAir for lightweight backpacking. Once inflated very comfortable and holds support for a good night's sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Best sleeping pad I've tried/used to date
customer_reviews.text: Super light. Very comfortable. Probably the most comfortable sleeping pad I've ever camped/hiked on. It's not the widest, but it gets the job done (I'm 6'0" and 190 lbs). Very easy to blow/fill up (tho, it did take me like 25 breathes). Little difficult to fold up and remove all the air, but not enough to knock down the star rating. Also... I remember seeing a bunch of stuff about these being loud and crinkly. I mean, there's some noise, but it's nothing super loud or terrible. Your neighbors might not appreciate the rustling, but you'll be too busy sleeping like a dream and not minding at all.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Backcountry approved
customer_reviews.text: Just what I expected. Not as noisy as some commented. Light/small/easy. Perfect for the backcountry.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Kral Jr

customer_reviews.title: Easy to inflate and deflate
customer_reviews.text: Used this mat on a Grand Canyon backcountry 4 days/3 nights hike. Easy to inflate and deflate. It slept well and did not make much of a crinkling sound. I am 5'7 and 135#. I would like one a bit wider, but it was fine for 3 nights.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Welch

customer_reviews.title: Ultralight Cycle Touring. Light, Easy to Use. Slept like I was at home.
customer_reviews.text: Used on a multiday 500miles ultralight bike tour. Don't know why I toured without this. So glad to have it in my life now!
customer_reviews.author: ArcticWolf

customer_reviews.title: Poor durability.
customer_reviews.text: This product deflated on me within the first hour of the first field test on soft soil, due to a small slit I found shortly after. Unfortunate given the price, I meant to buy once cry once.
customer_reviews.author: awesome

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: The crinkling noise everytime you move is terrible. Would return had I used within the return period. I bought two and my daughter and I had a sleepless night
customer_reviews.author: Janet Kost

customer_reviews.title: Best full lengh pad
customer_reviews.text: Best pad for the weight. I ended up returning it and saving 8 more ounces by going with the shorter, thigh length model.
customer_reviews.author: Chistopher Boyd

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like it. I tried to like it but I'm ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like it. I tried to like it but I'm 5'10" 220 lbs and it was just too narrow to be comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: bhollien

customer_reviews.title: Good and fits what I need
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very lightweight Holds it's air Is comfortable Cons: Fairly narrow if you sleep on your back Makes crunchy sounds if you move around a lot Takes time and effort to fill with breath
customer_reviews.author: Kramer

customer_reviews.title: This is Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This product is great, it is an integral part of my camping gear and I appreciate it's light weight and compact size.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Noisy, expensive, but you can't put a price on comfort. Ultralight as well!!!
customer_reviews.author: DrJWCTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Best pad I own.
customer_reviews.text: Smallest, lightest, and most comfortable sleeping pad I own. The Xlite is totally worth the price tag, but you have to take care of it.
customer_reviews.author: Ezra Tucklestein

customer_reviews.title: worst pad ever
customer_reviews.text: Be warned, this pad is extremely narrow and noisy--sounds like a potato chip bag. And if you are a small to normal sized human who likes to turn over occasionally in your sleep, you will feel like you are on a balance beam all night long.
customer_reviews.author: LCCARR

customer_reviews.title: Get it
customer_reviews.text: It definitely is as noisy as people say it is, but very comfortable, lightweight and easy to store, taking up minimal space. You can also easy adjust to your comfort by letting out some air if needed. I slept on it for 5 nights in a row and slept well...now to find the best pillow
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight air mattress.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried about comfort because I'm used to a regular air mattress but I actually like this better. It really improved how warm I slept at night. It packs down nice and small.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Moore

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and light - best buy ever!
customer_reviews.text: This mattress is the most comfortable thing on the planet and very light. I'd settle for nothing less than this!
customer_reviews.author: April Kriz

customer_reviews.title: Changed backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Does not disappoint. Has changed backpacking for me. Not self inflating, but I got used to using the pump sack.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever!

customer_reviews.text: I own two other Therm-a-rest products and have been impressed with both their durabity and comfort. I was looking forward to the NeoAir Xlite and while the size, weight and comfort were good, the noise was unbearable. We camp with two kids and I can only imagine how many times we would wake each other with all the rustling that the Xlite makes for even the simplest of movements.

customer_reviews.title: Though she be but little, she is fierce. Or.. something like that..
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It packs down to an impressive size. I have used it on some nights around 40-degrees & stayed pretty warm using what I would consider a barely adequate sleeping bag for those temps (I think I wore long base layers, wool socks, a hat, & a sweater w/maybe some thin gloves?). It's surprisingly comfortable considering how thin it is when blown up. It slips on my tent floor a bit but that doesn't bug me too much, just pitch your tent on flat ground or add something grippy to your tent floor. I'm looking forward to more good times being had with this piece of gear.

product_meta.title: Therm-a-Rest NeoAir Xlite Ultralight Backpacking Air Mattress
feature_bullets: The standard for ultralight backpacking, the XLite backpacking mattress delivers unrivaled comfort and warmth for minimal weight
Equipped with a dependable and rugged WingLock valve, the pad inflates 3 times faster than a standard valve and features lightning-fast deflation
4.2 R-value means the XLite can keep backpackers and campers warm in anything but the most extreme conditions
Patented Triangular Core Matrix delivers warmth using a continuous layer of thermal foam nestled between alternating ridges of air and foam
Measures 47x20x2.5 inches inflated, packs to 9x3.5 inches, and weighs 8 ounces; pump sack, stuff sack and repair kit included; made in the USA
